Overview

Welcome to the portfolio website for Dan McGinn! Here you'll find a selection of projects from my career in Product Management and my studies in Mechanical Engineering. I'm a design enthusiast with a passion for solving complex problems. When I'm not immersed in the world of design, you'll find me in the outdoors, embarking on adventures with friends and family.


Projects

SolidWorks Cloud Apps, 2019-Present

As a PM at SolidWorks, I manage a portfolio of cloud-based CAD apps including xDesign, xShape, & xFrame. My responsibilities include engaging with customers to understand their engineering workflows, leading R&D initiatives, and communicating the value of cloud-based CAD to customers and other stakeholders.

Images CAD Portfolio
YouTube Sample What's New Video
3D Models Explore 3D Printer with WebGL Viewer

SolidWorks for Makers, 2021

I played a pivotal role in the development and launch of SolidWorks for Makers. This solution empowers makers and hobbyists worldwide with professional design tools, fostering creativity, connectivity, and collaboration within the maker community. In recognition of my role in this initiative, I was a recipient of the 2021 Innovation Forwards Award, which celebrates the most innovative projects developed by Dassault Systèmes teams worldwide.

Link Product Website

LEGO Robotics Education Platform, 2019

For two summers in college, I had the privilege of working at the Tufts Center for Engineering Education & Outreach (CEEO). In the summer of 2019, I collaborated with a team at LEGO Robotics to create a user-friendly web-based programming platform for students. The platform facilitates easy connection to LEGO EV3s and offers guided Python tutorials for seamless learning.

GitHub GitHub Repository
Screenshots Prototype UI

Design for Emerging Markets, 2018

For my senior design project, I designed a fatigue testing machine for a company that manufactures modular roofing tiles for village homes in India. Leading a team of five engineering students, I personally designed and fabricated the mechanical assembly. Our team traveled to Ahmedabad, India to install the prototype. For my work on this project I was awarded the James P. O'Leary Award. The James P. O'Leary Award recognizes outstanding contributions in design by a senior engineering student at Tufts University.

EngineeringDrawings Engineering Drawings
YouTube Fundraising Video

Medical Device, 2017

In my junior year of college, I collaborated with a biomedical engineering student to invent a medical device for use in ocular surgery. Recognizing an issue with the current medicine injection process for treating macular degeneration, we developed a new design that would stabilize pressure in the ocular cavity. We collaborated with the Tufts Office of Technology Transfer to file a patent.

Patent International Patent Publication
Patent U.S. Patent Publication
